channel.title: Comments on: Thanks for ruining a good thing, or TRYING to!

item.title: By: Uhh
item.dc:creator: Uhh
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/03/31/thanks-for-ruining-a-good-thing-or-trying-to/#comment-426">eagleapex</a>.
You realize that open source means you give away your designs *for free*, right? Zero compensation for your work.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to eagleapex.

You realize that open source means you give away your designs *for free*, right? Zero compensation for your work.

item.title: By: wopot
item.dc:creator: wopot
item.description:
one ip can only vote every 6 hour. what is so difficult to use a CAPTCHA.
there are tousend of good vote scripts out there but why use this shitty one?
dont blame the ppl the fuck with the vote blame the admin how made this posible
item.content:encoded:
one ip can only vote every 6 hour.
what is so difficult to use a CAPTCHA.

there are tousend of good vote scripts out there
but why use this shitty one?

dont blame the ppl the fuck with the vote
blame the admin how made this posible

item.title: By: Jake
item.dc:creator: Jake
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/03/31/thanks-for-ruining-a-good-thing-or-trying-to/#comment-431">Stevie</a>.
IP addresses have already been given up (above). And anyway, turns out the person used a proxy!
Maybe next time do a little reading before you troll?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Stevie.

IP addresses have already been given up (above). And anyway, turns out the person used a proxy!

Maybe next time do a little reading before you troll?

item.title: By: Jake
item.dc:creator: Jake
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/03/31/thanks-for-ruining-a-good-thing-or-trying-to/#comment-423">Jesse Crawford</a>.
-10 for Jesse

item.title: By: Delirium
item.dc:creator: Delirium
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/03/31/thanks-for-ruining-a-good-thing-or-trying-to/#comment-423">Jesse Crawford</a>.
I totally agree! Also using a poll system which does not limit a vote to at least an IP address is very amateurish, imo it should be limited to an ip and an email address.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jesse Crawford.

I totally agree!
Also using a poll system which does not limit a vote to at least an IP address is very amateurish, imo it should be limited to an ip and an email address.

item.title: By: SP
item.dc:creator: SP
item.description:
Well... until a system exists there will be an hacker (or a lamer) that tries to force that system. This is in the spirit of hacking since the beginning of our technological history and this spirit (bad or good that it is) is the source of open source community and open hardware projects. We are all hackers (or lamers).
Now... I really don't understand why someone would be so stupid to cheat a voting machine just to have it's logo selected! I understand instead that if the system for voting you are using is hackable you cannot complain about what other people do with your system :)
Go and fix it! Computers don't need morality! I know the voting system is not your system ... cancel the votation and do it again with another system that is supposed to be bug free ;)
item.content:encoded:
Well… until a system exists there will be an hacker (or a lamer) that tries to force that system.
This is in the spirit of hacking since the beginning of our technological history and this spirit (bad or good that it is) is the source of open source community and open hardware projects.
We are all hackers (or lamers).

Now… I really don’t understand why someone would be so stupid to cheat a voting machine just to have it’s logo selected!
I understand instead that if the system for voting you are using is hackable you cannot complain about what other people do with your system ðŸ™‚

Go and fix it! Computers don’t need morality!
I know the voting system is not your system … cancel the votation and do it again with another system that is supposed to be bug free ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Josh
item.dc:creator: Josh
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/03/31/thanks-for-ruining-a-good-thing-or-trying-to/#comment-423">Jesse Crawford</a>.
+1 for Jesse

item.title: By: Stevie
item.dc:creator: Stevie
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/03/31/thanks-for-ruining-a-good-thing-or-trying-to/#comment-417">Bill Porter</a>.
Bill, hackers will be hackers. Welcome to the community. 1) Don't use a cheap, spammy, free 3rd party hosted poll. 2) Have some sense and turn on security in the first place.
Hackaday.com etc should NOT give up anyone's IP addresses.
To sum it up, you're a complete retard with nothing better to do. Go kill yourself.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Bill Porter.

Bill, hackers will be hackers. Welcome to the community. 1) Don’t use a cheap, spammy, free 3rd party hosted poll. 2) Have some sense and turn on security in the first place.

Hackaday.com etc should NOT give up anyone’s IP addresses.

To sum it up, you’re a complete retard with nothing better to do. Go kill yourself.

item.title: By: Frank
item.dc:creator: Frank
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/03/31/thanks-for-ruining-a-good-thing-or-trying-to/#comment-417">Bill Porter</a>.
What would that accomplish? Shame?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Bill Porter.

What would that accomplish? Shame?

item.title: By: Joe
item.dc:creator: Joe
item.description: What if the person admitted that they did it? What do you do then? Sounds like a waste of time. I can imagine much better uses of talent. Who cares if somebody hacked a voting system. Who cares if somebody finds the person who did it. Sounds like somebody wants to pick a fight because they've been had.
item.content:encoded: What if the person admitted that they did it? What do you do then? Sounds like a waste of time. I can imagine much better uses of talent. Who cares if somebody hacked a voting system. Who cares if somebody finds the person who did it. Sounds like somebody wants to pick a fight because they’ve been had.
